intro: Linanthus watsonii, commonly known as Watson's linanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has hairy, branching stems. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. Linanthus watsonii is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
